item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Chai-1 Defeats AlphaFold 3 (132 points | 48 comments)
2. A good day to trie-hard: saving compute 1% at a time (438 points | 133 comments)
3. Google Illuminate: Books and papers turned into audio (360 points | 155 comments)
4. Tutorial on diffusion models for imaging and vision (104 points | 9 comments)
5. Lottery Simulator (2023) (109 points | 45 comments)
6. Building the Same App Using Various Web Frameworks (11 points | 4 comments)
7. Rust in illumos (60 points | 23 comments)
8. Jeremy Couillard's video games capture what it's like to be alive (21 points | 1 comment)
9. Satellites Spotting Aircraft (153 points | 36 comments)
10. Another police raid in Germany (335 points | 189 comments)
11. What is the best pointer tagging method? (37 points | 2 comments)
12. Among the Moss Piglets: The First Image of a Tardigrade (1773) (41 points | 4 comments)
13. Arvo Pärt's Journey (31 points | 4 comments)
14. Apple must pay 13B euros in back taxes, EU's top court rules (475 points | 531 comments)
15. People who are colorblind are less likely to be picky eaters (27 points | 13 comments)
16. Consent-O-Matic – automatically fills ubiquitous pop-ups with your preferences (8 points | discuss)
17. Our Git Hash Bug (114 points | 55 comments)
18. Floral formula (105 points | 10 comments)
19. Building a robot dog and uploading every second of it to YouTube (Part 1) [video] (15 points | 10 comments)
20. Show HN: Visual DB – Web front end for your database (120 points | 37 comments)
21. Pixhell Attack: Leaking Info from Air-Gap Computers via 'Singing Pixels' (51 points | 21 comments)
22. Tomato64: A port of Tomato Firmware to x86_64 (97 points | 27 comments)
23. Flipper Zero Gets Major Firmware Update, Can Eavesdrop on Walkie-Talkies (132 points | 26 comments)
24. Debugging in the Multiverse (170 points | 53 comments)
25. Show HN: YourNextStore – an open-source Shopify with Stripe as the back end (195 points | 57 comments)
26. What you can get out of a high-quality font (250 points | 77 comments)
27. Git Bash is my preferred Windows shell (120 points | 95 comments)
28. How we made Jupyter notebooks load faster (123 points | 29 comments)
29. Deductive Verification for Chain-of-Thought Reasoning in LLMs (56 points | 5 comments)
30. Microwave Oven Failure: Spontaneously turned on by its LED display (74 points | 39 comments)
